availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Louisiana
City of New Orleans

Personally appeared before me 2nd Justice of the Peace S. Myers, duly Commissioned in & for the Parish of Orleans and State aforesaid, who being duly sworn doth swear that he will well & truly execute and perform all the duties of Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky in the state aforesaid according to the laws of the state of Kentucky.

In witness whereof he has pleace his signature hereto.
F. C. Zacharie

Sworn to before me and signature acknowledged.
Samuel Myers
2 Justice of the Peace
Parish of Orleans

Comr Deeds
Louisiana
Oath of F. C. Zacharie
filed
9 Oct/65
